Uses of Class
Vector

    • Uses of Vector in <Unnamed>

      Methods in <Unnamed> that return Vector 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector VectorUtil.addition(Vector a, Vector b)
      addition() adds two Vectors' respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension together
      Vector VectorUtil.average(Vector a, Vector b)
      average() adds two Vectors respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension together and divides each vector pair in half, in effect finding their average
      Vector VectorList.createVector(java.lang.String word)
      The createVector() function takes in a word from the VectorList and returns its associated Vector
      Vector VectorList.randomVector()
      The randomVector() function takes a word at random from the VectorList it is used on and returns it as a single Vector
      Vector VectorUtil.scalarMultiplication(Vector v, int scalar)
      scalarMultiplication() takes one vector and multiplies its vector components by a scalar (a whole number which changes the magnitude, but not the direction, of a vector).
      Vector VectorUtil.subtraction(Vector a, Vector b)
      subtraction() substracts one Vector's respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension from another
      private static Vector[] Game.takeGuesses(Vector randomWord, VectorList v)
      takeGuesses() does just that - it takes the task of taking in the user's three guesses as to what the "random word" in the game might be.

      double VectorUtil.distance(Vector a, Vector b)
      distance() calculates the aptly-named distance between two Vectors.
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> SimilarityUtil.findAllSimilarities(Vector v, VectorList list)
      The method findAllSimilarities() finds *all* the similarities between the input vector and all the vectors within the VectorList.
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> SimilarityUtil.findClosestSimilarities(Vector[] vecs, VectorList list, int k)
      findClosestSimilarities() is the only public and usable method, and uses the two previous functions to achieve this goal.
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> SimilarityUtil.findMeanOfSimilarities(Vector[] vecs, VectorList list)
      findMeanOfSimilarities() takes in a list of an assumed correct input of 3 vectors, and calculates the mean similarities between the three "similarity lists" which were created with the previous function, findAllSimilarities().

      Vector VectorUtil.scalarMultiplication(Vector v, int scalar)
      scalarMultiplication() takes one vector and multiplies its vector components by a scalar (a whole number which changes the magnitude, but not the direction, of a vector).
      static double VectorUtil.similarity(Vector a, Vector b)
      similarity() calculates the apparent closeness of two words using a mathematical formula known as the cosinus similarity, whose formula is written below: similarity(va, vb) = ((va.vec1 * vb.vec1) + ...
      Vector VectorUtil.subtraction(Vector a, Vector b)
